intro: Securinega obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate securinega, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy, and it produces a milky sap that can be toxic. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though care must be taken due to its potentially harmful properties.
